item.title: Phase 7
item.description: Thank you for playing! For your (small) prize, only keep the lowercase letters and use them as a key for yet another Vigenère cipher used in your birthday card! ...

item.title: index
item.description: Welcome to Vesper. There are Links for most of the information that you will require. If you’re stuck, ask. Have fun, and good luck! Begin.

item.title: ASCII
item.description: ASCII stands for American Standard Code for Information Interchange. It is a character encoding standard used to represent text in computers and communication equipment.

item.title: Phase 6
item.description: Now that you have the password, we’re gonna need it to program something (together, of course). It’ll be fun! We will need to program the solution, because doing this manually, while possible, will most likely drive you crazy.

item.title: Basic Auth
item.description: HTTP Basic Authentication is a simple and widely used authentication mechanism in web development. It allows clients to access protected resources on a server by providing a username and password.

item.title: REST
item.description: REST, or Representational State Transfer, is an architectural style for designing networked applications, particularly web services. It provides a set of principles that guide how web services should be structured and how they should behave.

item.title: API
item.description: An API, or Application Programming Interface, is a set of rules and protocols that allows different software applications (or humans) to communicate with each other ...

item.title: Phase 5
item.description: Nicely done! Completing Phase 4 should’ve yielded a URL, but you’ll quickly notice that it’s not something you can just open with your favorite web browser ...

item.title: Phase 4
item.description: QR Codes are very useful. Especially when they are intact. This will be your clue for this phase.
